Title: the hot troll deviation

Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard enters in a silk dressing gown, puts on romantic music and sets up mood lighting. Gets onto bed.
Penny’s apartment. Penny is gathering laundry.
(Sheldon opens his office door. It bangs against a desk. Inside, Raj is sat behind a huge, ornate antique wooden desk in an enormous antique swivel chair.)
Raj: I’m telling you, if xenon emits ultraviolet light, then those dark matter discoveries must be wrong.
Oh, you’re so arrogant. If you were a superhero, your name would be Captain Arrogant. And you know what your superpower would be? Arrogance.
Has it occurred to you you’re missing the big picture? If you look at neutron scattering data…
It’s one of his best moves.
You’re being unreasonable. Why can’t I have a desk?
You have a desk.
But I can’t have one.
Oh, but there’s money for a drawer full of Red Vines, a marshmallow shooting rifle, and a super executive ant farm with glow-in-the-dark sand?
Yeah, what if I buy my own desk?
Yes?
And I can put it in your office?
You said I could buy a desk.
Is that the American idiom for giant, big-ass desk?
Can you say it again for me?
One more time?
Now three times fast?
That’s for me, Ramon, Julio, Jesus and Rodrigo to know and you to find out.
No.
No.
No.
I have three brothers and two sisters, Sheldon, I can do this all day.
Knock yourself out.
No.
No.
No. It’s too Brobdingnagian.
Well, seeing as its purpose was to piss you off, I’d say it’s spot-on.
Thank you.
Hey, Sheldon?
No. See what I did there? I turned it around.
It’s not gonna work, dude, I grew up in India, an entire subcontinent where cows walk in the street, and nobody has ever had a solid bowel movement.
Well, we’ll just see how your noxious gas fares against my cinnamon-apple-scented aroma therapy candles.
This is not over.
Sheldon: Yes, well, if we lived in a world where slow-moving xenon produced light, then you’d be correct. Also, pigs would fly, my derriere would produce cotton candy, and The Phantom Menace would be a timeless classic.
You’re wrong again. If my superpower were arrogance, my name would be Dr. Arroganto.
Nothing. I just wanted to make Raj stop talking.
Hello. I see you decided to go with pathetic and frightened.
Our collaboration is a work of the mind. We don’t need desks.

Oh, Lord, will this day never end? As I’ve explained repeatedly to Dr. Koothrappali, whose ability to comprehend the American idiom fails him when it’s convenient, there’s absolutely no money in my budget for additional office furniture.
All right, all right. He can buy his own desk.
Well, you really want to dot the I’s and cross the T’s, don’t you?
They do some of their best work at night.
Why on earth are you telling me all this?
This isn’t a desk. This is a Brobdingnagian monstrosity.
Brobdingnagian, Brobdingna… How did you even get it in here?
All right, you’ve made your point. A fine prank, very amusing. Now get it out.
All right, if you’re not going to remove it, I’ll remove it for you.
Why do you even want this here? Its size is completely disproportionate to its purpose.
All right, I see what’s going on. This is the opening salvo in what will be an escalating series of juvenile tit-for-tat exchanges. Well titted.
Stand by for my upcoming tat.
I’m making hydrogen sulphide and ammonia gas. Just a little experiment in pest control.
Well, we’ll just see how long you can hold out.
Howard (laughs): I love watching Raj and Sheldon try to work together.
Leonard: Yeah, it’s like if Alien and Predator decided to go partners in a Jamba Juice.
Hang on a second. I could have the fruit platter.
Does it have melon on it?
No, I can’t eat melon.
When was the last time you saw her?
Hey.
You know, you never told me what happened between you and Bernadette.
Yeah, I guessed that.
That covers anything from farting in bed to killing a homeless guy. Oh, my God. You ran over a hobo.
All right, fine. So you want to get back together with her, but you’re too ashamed to face her because of whatever it is you did.
Okay. Well, how about this? Kidnap Bernadette from the opera wearing a creepy mask so she doesn’t know it’s you.
Why can’t he have a desk, Sheldon?
Sheldon.
Why would you want a glow-in-the-dark ant farm?
So anyway, Howard asked Penny to talk to Bernadette, and she did, and Bernadette agreed to meet him for a cup of coffee.
Yeah?
I don’t know. Sometimes your movements are so lifelike, I forget you’re not a real boy.
Oh, congratulations. Have you broken it to the troll yet?
No. Steve Patterson told me.
Yeah.
He’s Glissinda the troll.
So anyway, that’s great news about you and Bernadette.
Ah. Well, I guess for you guys that’s like regular golf.
Yeah, and don’t you forget it.
Oh, God, what’s that smell? (Knocks on Sheldon’s door. Sheldon answers in a gas mask). Oh-ho-hoo!
What are you doing in there?
Didn’t you say you’re making hydrogen sulphide gas?
Isn’t that flammable?
Penny: What’s up?

Well, I’d ask you guys if you want dessert, but I know Sheldon doesn’t eat dessert on Tuesdays. And even if Raj wanted something, he couldn’t tell me. Howard won’t order anything, but he will come up with some sort of skeevy comment involving the words pie or cheesecake. And Leonard’s lactose intolerant, so he can’t eat anything here without his intestines blowing up like a balloon animal.
You want the fruit platter?
Yeah.
Oh, Howard, heads up. Your ex-girlfriend just came in for her shift.
Not since I found out the teddy bear you gave me had a webcam in it.
Oh, absolutely.
Yeah, sure. Just yesterday, she asked, why is Howard hiding under the table?
Oh, no, not at first. Right after I pointed it out.
Uh, not that I know of. Hey, while we’re on the subject, why did you guys break up anyway?
Howard, if you want my help, I’ve got to know what happened.
Yeah, that’s what I’m counting on. Spill.
Um, the online game? Sure.
Oh, God. I think I see where this is going.
Oh, you’re right. That is so embarrassing.
Bernadette or the troll?
Well, what was your side?
Really? And that didn’t make her feel better?
Oh, gee, Howard, I really don’t want to get in the middle of this.
Okay, I will think about it.
Yeah, I said I’d think about it.
Okay, fine. Look, look, I’m calling her now! See?
Hey, how are we doing over here? Can I get you something to drink?
Are you gonna want to order food?
Okay.
That’s what I told him when he asked me. I hope that’s not out of line.
Oh. I’m sorry.
You know, you look thirsty. I brought you some iced tea.
It’s passion fruit, new on the menu.
Not where I can hear you guys.
Yeah, that’ll hold me for a while.
Complimentary nachos! You enjoy. Never had sex? Wow.
Hey, this is a little awkward, but my manager says I can’t actually give nachos away. So, just take that when you’re ready.
Howard (after Raj whispers to him): No, no, no. He won. Suck it up.
Howard: Oh, not since we broke up. Wow. How am I going to play this? Sophisticated and relaxed? Friendly, noncommittal? Cold and distant? (Hides under table).
So, my dear, we meet again.
I’ve missed you, Katee Sackhoff.
Anything.
Why are you in bed with me? If we start to question this, it all falls apart.
Okay, if you insist.
No, Ma!
Maybe it committed suicide! Leave me alone! Now, where were we?
Bernadette? What are you doing here?
No, I’m not.
Okay, I’m a little confused here.
Not that kind of confused.
No, of course not.
Wait. Katee, why are you leaving?
Great, Ma!
And with that mental picture, I think we’re done for the evening.
I did a stupid thing.
It was the kind of thing that makes it kind of hard to face her now.
No. Stop asking.
In a nutshell.
Now, you see, I don’t know if you’re kidding or not.
Okay, what if he buys his own desk?
Why?
Would you have opened the door if you knew it was me?
I just have a question. Does Bernadette ever talk about me?
She does?
She saw that, huh?
Let me ask you something else. Is she seeing anybody?
Oh, I’d rather not say.
But it’s embarrassing.
Okay. Well, you know World of Warcraft?
Well, did you know that the characters in the game can have sex with each other?
Her name was Glissinda the Troll. Bernadette walked in on me while we were doing the cyber-nasty under the Bridge of Souls.
Would you talk to her?
Bernadette. She was so mad at me, she wouldn’t even listen to my side of the story.
Well, for all we know, Glissinda the Troll wasn’t even a real woman. I mean, she could’ve been a 50-year-old truck driver in New Jersey.
Will you talk to her, see if there’s any chance at all we could get back together?
No. Why would you? I’m just another lonely nerd, living with his mother, trying to find any scrap of happiness he can. You know, maybe to make up for the fact that his dad left him when he was 11.
You know, I’ve always blamed myself for him leaving. I always thought it was because I wasn’t the son he wanted.
I wasn’t athletic, yeah, I was kind of sickly.
Thank you.
Oh, no, that’s okay. How have you been?
Same. I took a scuba-diving course over the summer, but it turns out I’m terrified of the ocean.
You wouldn’t know anybody who wants to buy a wet suit, boy’s large? Yeah, forget it. Not important. So, are you seeing anyone?
Not for me, thanks.
Maybe later.
So, are you seeing anybody?
Penny, can we have a little privacy?
Well, you know how it is with guys. I mean, we have needs and…
Well, not real girls.
Isn’t there somewhere else you can be?

Okay, fine. I’ll admit, there are dark, sordid little corners of the Internet where the name Wolowizard is whispered in hushed tones. But the only reason I go there, the only reason I’ve ever gone there is because I don’t have a real woman in my life. You happy?
Yeah, but we weren’t, I-I mean, you and I never…
Yeah.
What do you mean, whose fault was that?
I didn’t think you wanted me to make the move.
Really?
Son of a bitch.
Yeah, we had a really great talk, and we’re gonna start seeing each other again.
Did Penny tell you about that?
The greasy old fat guy in Facilities Management?
How’d he know about it?
Yeah. I think I’m gonna take her to miniature golf.
Short jokes? Really? You’re, like, a quarter of an inch taller than me.
I had a good time.
You said, well, the move, remember?
No, you don’t. It’s me. The lusty charmer with the fancy patter and the hoochie pants.
Bernadette: I believe you were about to rip off my uniform with your teeth.
Clearly you are. Otherwise, based on past experience, we’d be done by now.
She’s leaving because you really want to be with me.
Sorry, I had to clock out.
Okay. You know, busy, school, work. You?
What about you, have you been seeing anybody?
So you’ve been seeing other girls?
Howard, you did have a real woman. I was right there in the next room while you were clicking that troll’s brains out.
Well, we could’ve been having sex, but you never made the move.
Howard, a girl doesn’t go out with a man like you, with your looks, your fancy patter and your tight hoochie pants if she’s not expecting him to eventually make the move.
Oh, not now. We’re starting a new relationship. I need to get to know you again.
Katee Sackhoff: Why am I wearing my Battlestar Galactica flight suit in bed?
Sorry. Oh, ravish me, Howard. My loins ache for you.
Well, if I had to guess, I’d say I’m here because you saw me earlier this evening, and you’re still hung up on me.
Howard, do you have latent homosexual tendencies?
George, let me ask you something. How did you deal with being typecast as a science fiction icon?
Tell me about it. It’s frackin’ frustrating.
Kiss her good night. All right, now a little tongue.
Don’t listen to him. She wants it. Tongue. Luh-luh-luh-luh-luh. See? Now make the move.
Trust me, she’s ready. Make the move.
Listen to me, Howard, it’s time. Make the move, now.
Mrs Wolowitz (off): Howard, have you seen my girdle?!
Mrs Wolowitz: I can’t find it, and I’m late for my Weight Watchers meeting!
Howard, I found my girdle! It was in the dryer!
I think it shrunk! I’m spilling out like the Pillsbury Doughboy here!
George Takei: So you say. Yet, here I am.
It’s difficult. You try and stretch as an actor, do Strindberg, O’Neill, but all they want is, Course laid in, Captain.
Hold on there. We’ve only just rekindled the romance. Let’s not sully the moment with the exchange of saliva.
No, no, no. A lady wants to be wooed, courted slowly.
Sheldon (voice): (Knock, knock, knock) Penny? (Knock, knock, knock) Penny? (Knock, knock, knock) Penny? (Penny opens door. Howard is stood outside with a hand-held voice recorder.) Penny?
I’ll turn off the music when you get rid of that salmonella-ridden parakeet!
That’s it! Prepare for marshmallow death!
Raj (voice): Sorry, dude, the thermostat’s on my side of the room, so it stays Mumbai hot in here until you turn off that stupid Indian music!
Oh, too bad! Sheldon’s pathologically afraid of birds! Hey, look, Sheldon! Birdie, birdie, birdie!

And I can put it in your office?

Penny’s apartment. Penny is gathering laundry.
Penny (picking up a top and sniffing it)
(Knock, knock, knock) Penny? (Knock, knock, knock) Penny? (Knock, knock, knock) Penny? (Penny opens door. Howard is stood outside with a hand-held voice recorder.) Penny?
Would you have opened the door if you knew it was me?
Not since I found out the teddy bear you gave me had a webcam in it.
I just have a question. Does Bernadette ever talk about me?
Yeah, sure. Just yesterday, she asked, why is Howard hiding under the table?
Oh, no, not at first. Right after I pointed it out.
Let me ask you something else. Is she seeing anybody?
Uh, not that I know of. Hey, while we’re on the subject, why did you guys break up anyway?

Yeah, that’s what I’m counting on. Spill.
Okay. Well, you know World of Warcraft?
Well, did you know that the characters in the game can have sex with each other?
Oh, God. I think I see where this is going.

Oh, you’re right. That is so embarrassing.

Will you talk to her, see if there’s any chance at all we could get back together?
Oh, gee, Howard, I really don’t want to get in the middle of this.
No. Why would you? I’m just another lonely nerd, living with his mother, trying to find any scrap of happiness he can. You know, maybe to make up for the fact that his dad left him when he was 11.
Okay, I will think about it.
You know, I’ve always blamed myself for him leaving. I always thought it was because I wasn’t the son he wanted.
Yeah, I said I’d think about it.
I wasn’t athletic, yeah, I was kind of sickly.
Okay, fine. Look, look, I’m calling her now! See?
So anyway, Howard asked Penny to talk to Bernadette, and she did, and Bernadette agreed to meet him for a cup of coffee.
Why on earth are you telling me all this?
I don’t know. Sometimes your movements are so lifelike, I forget you’re not a real boy.
